TuningRoot.Instance:
<TunableVariant type="None" name="user_level" class="OptionalTunable" default="disabled" display="User Level" description="Threshold test for the current user value of a career. If user_level is set without career then it will pass if any of their careers pass the threshold test. If set along with career then it will only pass if the specified career passes the threshold test for user level. The min and max for the user level are inclusive. So the Sim can have any career level that meets the following equation and it will pass. min <= current career level <= max." group="General">
<TunableTuple name="enabled" class="TunableInterval" display="Enabled" description="Threshold test for the current user value of a career. If user_level is set without career then it will pass if any of their careers pass the threshold test. If set along with career then it will only pass if the specified career passes the threshold test for user level. The min and max for the user level are inclusive. So the Sim can have any career level that meets the following equation and it will pass. min <= current career level <= max." group="General">
<TunableVariant type="None" name="user_level" class="OptionalTunable" default="disabled" display="User Level" description="Threshold test for the current user value of a career. If user_level is set without career then it will pass if any of their careers pass the threshold test. If set along with career then it will only pass if the specified career passes the threshold test for user level. The min and max for the user level are inclusive. So the Sim can have any career level that meets the following equation and it will pass. min <= current career level <= max." group="General">
<TunableTuple name="enabled" class="TunableInterval" display="Enabled" description="Threshold test for the current user value of a career. If user_level is set without career then it will pass if any of their careers pass the threshold test. If set along with career then it will only pass if the specified career passes the threshold test for user level. The min and max for the user level are inclusive. So the Sim can have any career level that meets the following equation and it will pass. min <= current career level <= max." group="General">
<TunableEnum type="Operator" name="comparison" class="TunableOperator" default="GREATER" display="Comparison" static_entries="sims4-math.Operator" description="The operator to use for the comparison. Specifics: Stat Value Game High Score." group="General" />
<TunableVariant type="None" name="max_water_depth" class="OptionalTunable" default="disabled" display="Max Water Depth" description="(float) If provided, each vertex of the test polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at most this deep. Values <= 0 indicate placement in ocean is invalid." group="General">
<TunableVariant type="None" name="min_water_depth" class="OptionalTunable" default="disabled" display="Min Water Depth" description="(float) If provided, each vertex of the test polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at least this deep. Values <= 0 indicate placement on land is valid." group="General">
<TunableEnum type="Operator" name="comparison" class="TunableOperator" default="GREATER_OR_EQUAL" display="Comparison" static_entries="sims4-math.Operator" description="The operator that we will use to compare the number of situations running to the number of objects that pass our criteria. Specifics: Situation Count Object Count" group="General" />
<Tunable type="bool" name="include_thresholds" class="Tunable" default="True" display="Include Thresholds" description="If true, converts the 'low < markup < high' into 'low <= markup <= high'." group="General" />
<TunableList name="blacklist" class="TunableEnumSet" display="Blacklist" description="If any are specified, the value of all must be <= the blacklist threshold for the test to pass. If weather_service is not running, test will pass if partly_cloudy is in white list (or whitelist is empty) but not black list." group="General" unique_entries="true">
<TunableVariant type="None" name="display_subtext" class="TunableLocalizedStringFactoryVariant" default="single" display="Display Subtext" description="If tuned, this text will display below the button for this Finish Action. Span tags can be used to change the color of the text to green/positive and red/negative. TEXT will make the word TEXT green TEXT will make the word TEXT red" group="General">
